alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:53AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Iroquois, southern Newton and western Benton Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 253 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Martinton to near Milford. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kentland and Morocco around 305 AM CDT. Brook around 315 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Dunnington, Raub, Iroquois, Donovan, Woodland and Wellington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
